019package org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal;
020
021import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NOT_FOUND;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
027
028import java.util.Comparator;
029import java.util.List;
030
031import org.apiguardian.api.API;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
033import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider;
034
035/**
036 *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot defined as a rule.
037 *  Instead a list defines the sequence.
038 *
039 *  @param  <T> The type to order.
040 *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may be
041 *      the same as the type itself.
042 *
043 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
044 *  @version $Id: ListBasedComparator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
045 *  @since 0.0.5
046 *
047 *  @UMLGraph.link
048 */
049@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ListBasedComparator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
050@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
051public class ListBasedComparator<T,K> implements Comparator<T>
052{
053        /*---------------*\
054    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
055        \*---------------*/
056    /**
057     *  A simple implementation of
058     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
059     *  that returns the instance itself as the sort order key.
060     *
061     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
062     *  @version $Id: ListBasedComparator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
063     *  @since 9
064     *
065     *  @UMLGraph.link
066     *
067     *  @param  <T> The type to order.
068     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
069     *      be the same as the type itself. At least, an instance of type
070     *      {@code T} must be assignable to {@code K}.
071     *
072     *  @UMLGraph.link
073     */
074    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ListBasedComparator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
075    private static class SimpleKeyProvider<T,K> implements KeyProvider<T,K>
076    {
077            /*--------------*\
078        ====** Constructors **=================================================
079            \*--------------*/
080        /**
081         *  Creates a new {@code SimpleKeyProvider} instance.
082         */
083        public SimpleKeyProvider() { /* Just exists */ }
084
085            /*---------*\
086        ====** Methods **======================================================
087            \*---------*/
088        /**
089         *  {@inheritDoc}
090         *
091         *  @return The instance itself as the sort order key; {@code null} if
092         *      the instance is {@code null} itself.
093         */
094        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
095        @Override
096        public final K getKey( final T instance ) { return (K) instance; }
097    }
098    //  class SimpleKeyProvider
099
100        /*-----------*\
101    ====** Constants **========================================================
102        \*-----------*/
103    /**
104     *  An empty array of {@code ListBasedComparator<T>} objects.
105     */
106    @SuppressWarnings( "rawtypes" )
107    public static final ListBasedComparator [] EMPTY_ListBasedComparator_ARRAY = new ListBasedComparator [0];
108
109        /*------------*\
110    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
111        \*------------*/
112    /**
113     *  The comparator that is used to determine the sort order for instances
114     *  that do not have their keys in the list; may be {@code null}.
115     */
116    private final Comparator<? super T> m_Comparator;
117
118    /**
119     *  The key provider.
120     */
121    private final KeyProvider<T,K> m_KeyProvider;
122
123    /**
124     *  The list with the sort order keys.
125     */
126    private final K [] m_Keys;
127
128        /*--------------*\
129    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
130        \*--------------*/
131    /**
132     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
133     *
134     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
135     */
136    @SuppressWarnings( "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod" )
137    public ListBasedComparator( final K [] keys )
138    {
139        this( new SimpleKeyProvider<>(), null, null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ) );
140    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
141
142    /**
143     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
144     *
145     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
146     */
147    public ListBasedComparator( final List<K> keys )
148    {
149        this( new SimpleKeyProvider<>(), null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ), null );
150    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
151
152    /**
153     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
154     *
155     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
156     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
157     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
158     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
159     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
160     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
161     *      {@link Comparable}
162     *      interface.
163     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
164     */
165    public ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final List<K> keys )
166    {
167        this( keyProvider, comparator, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ), null );
168    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
169
170    /**
171     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
172     *
173     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
174     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
175     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
176     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
177     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
178     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
179     *      {@link Comparable}
180     *      interface.
181     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
182     */
183    @SafeVarargs
184    public ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final K... keys )
185    {
186        this( keyProvider, comparator, null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ) );
187    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
188
189    /**
190     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
191     *
192     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
193     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
194     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
195     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
196     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
197     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
198     *      {@link Comparable}
199     *      interface.
200     *  @param  keysList    The sort order keys in a list; is {@code null} when
201     *      {@code keysArray} is not {@code null}.
202     *  @param  keysArray   The sort order keys in an array; is {@code null}
203     *      when {@code keysList} is not {@code null}.
204     */
205    @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked", "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod"} )
206    private ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final List<K> keysList, final K [] keysArray )
207    {
208        assert isNull( keysList ) ^ isNull( keysArray ) : "Both, keysList and keysArray are either null or not null";
209
210        //noinspection SuspiciousArrayCast
211        m_Keys = nonNull( keysList ) ? (K []) keysList.toArray() : keysArray.clone();
212        m_KeyProvider = requireNonNullArgument( keyProvider, "keyProvider" );
213        m_Comparator = comparator;
214    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
215
216        /*---------*\
217    ====** Methods **==========================================================
218        \*---------*/
219    /**
220     *  {@inheritDoc}
221     */
222    @SuppressWarnings( {"rawtypes", "unchecked", "preview"} )
223    @Override
224    public final int compare( final T o1, final T o2 )
225    {
226        var retValue = 0; // Assuming that the values are equal …
227        if( o1 != o2 ) // Not identical …
228        {
229            /*
230             *  Retrieve the keys and get the index for the respective key. A
231             *  value of -1 (NOT_FOUND) indicates that the key was not found in
232             *  the list of keys and that the natural order should be used for
233             *  the respective entry.
234             */
235            final var key1 = m_KeyProvider.getKey( o1 );
236            final var index1 = searchKey( key1 );
237            assert index1 == NOT_FOUND || index1 >= 0;
238            final var key2 = m_KeyProvider.getKey( o2 );
239            final var index2 = searchKey( key2 );
240            assert index2 == NOT_FOUND || index2 >= 0;
241
242            if( index1 == index2 )
243            {
244                /*
245                 *  If both index values are not -1, this means that the keys
246                 *  are equals and therefore the instances are to be treated
247                 *  as equals, too.
248                 */
249                if( index1 == NOT_FOUND )
250                {
251                    //---* Both are not in the list *--------------------------
252                    //noinspection IfStatementWithTooManyBranches
253                    if( nonNull( m_Comparator ) )
254                    {
255                        //---* Use the comparator if we have one *-------------
256                        retValue = signum( m_Comparator.compare( o1, o2 ) );
257                    }
258                    else if( key1 instanceof Comparable comparable )
259                    {
260                        //---* Use the implicit natural order *----------------
261                        retValue = signum( comparable.compareTo( key2 ) );
262                    }
263                    else if( (o1 != key1) || (o2 != key2) )
264                    /*
265                     * Yes, we know that we do check for *identity* here! If
266                     * no explicit KeyProvider was given, the SimpleKeyProvider
267                     * is used, and that will return o# as Key#. This would
268                     * mean that we have performed the action below already
269                     * above …
270                     */
271                    {
272                        if( o1 instanceof Comparable comparable )
273                        {
274                            retValue = signum( comparable.compareTo( o2 ) );
275                        }
276                    }
277                    else
278                    {
279                        /*
280                         * We have no idea how to order, so we just compare the
281                         * hashcodes of the keys.
282                         */
283                        retValue = Long.signum( (long) key1.hashCode() - (long) key2.hashCode() );
284                    }
285                }
286            }
287            else
288            {
289                /*
290                 * That one that is in the list is less than the other one.
291                 */
292                if( index1 == NOT_FOUND )
293                {
294                    retValue = 1;
295                }
296                else if( index2 == NOT_FOUND )
297                {
298                    retValue = -1;
299                }
300                else
301                {
302                    /*
303                     * That one that is closer to the begin of the list is less
304                     * than the other one.
305                     */
306                    retValue = signum( index1 - index2 );
307                }
308            }
309        }
310
311        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
312        return retValue;
313    }   //  compare()
314
315    /**
316     *  Searches the given key in the list.
317     *
318     *  @param  key The key.
319     *  @return The index in the list or
320     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NOT_FOUND}
321     *      ({@value org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NOT_FOUND})
322     *      if the key is not in the list.
323     */
324    private int searchKey( final K key )
325    {
326        /*
327         * Although using Arrays.binarySearch() looked a good idea at first
328         * place, it does not work as we are not allowed to sort the key's
329         * array, for obvious reasons.
330         */
331        var found = false;
332        var retValue = m_Keys.length;
333        while( !found && (--retValue >= 0) )
334        {
335            found = (key == m_Keys [retValue]) || (nonNull( key ) && key.equals( m_Keys [retValue] ));
336        }
337
338        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
339        return retValue;
340    }   //  searchKey()
341}
342//  class ListBasedComparator
343
344/*
345 *  End of File
